title: 106_s2926
content: The "Social Security Family Relief Act" allows for the continuation of benefits through the month of the beneficiary's death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Old-Age Insurance Benefits and Wife's Insurance Benefits, including changes in the month of eligibility and redesignating subparagraphs. Conforming amendments are also made to ensure consistency in the Act. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Husband's and Child's Insurance Benefits, including changes in eligibility months and redesignating subparagraphs for consistency. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Widow's and Widower's Insurance Benefits eligibility months and criteria. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust eligibility criteria for Mother's, Father's, and Parent's Insurance Benefits, including changes related to remarriage and death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust eligibility criteria for Mother's, Father's, and Parent's Insurance Benefits, including changes related to remarriage and death. The amendments include adjustments to Disability Insurance Benefits, Benefits at Age 72 for Certain Uninsured Individuals, and changes in the month preceding certain events. SEC. 3. COMPUTATION AND PAYMENT OF LAST MONTHLY PAYMENT. Amends Section 202 of the Social Security Act to address the termination of the last monthly insurance benefit due to death. The monthly insurance benefit for an individual who dies will be calculated based on the number of days in the month before their death. This calculation is applied after all other adjustments to the benefit have been made. Payment will be made according to the provisions in section 204(d). The monthly insurance benefit for a deceased individual is calculated based on the days before their death, with payment made according to section 204(d). Disability Insurance Benefits under Section 223 of the Act are also amended. "The last payment of benefits is terminated upon death." The amount of an individual's monthly benefit under this section paid for the month of their death is calculated based on a fraction of days in that month. This applies after all other adjustments have been made, and payment is made as provided in section 204(d). Benefits at Age 72 for Certain Uninsured Individuals are amended under Section 228 of the Act. The last payment of benefits is adjusted upon the death of the individual, calculated based on the days in the month before the death. This adjustment is made after all other benefit adjustments have been applied. SEC. 4. DISREGARD OF BENEFIT FOR MONTH OF DEATH UNDER FAMILY MAXIMUM PROVISIONS. Amends the Social Security Act to disregard the benefit payable for the month of the insured individual's death. SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments apply to deaths occurring after the enactment of this Act.
